result.execSummary:
The defendant Irwin Ricky Long was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection. DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
- Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution.
- AODA, programs or treatment as recommended.
- Do not use or possess illegally controlled substances.
- Random screening.
- Seek/maintain employment.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
CONCURRENT with Count 4; credit for 235 days

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Irwin Ricky Long

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Cooperation Agreement received and filed./ds

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) AODA, programs or treatment as recommended; 4) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 5) random screening; 6) seek and maintain employment. 

COURT ORDERS:
- DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds;
- defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 4:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 36 months with 235 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 18 months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 18 months; pay mandatory costs, assessments  and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 5:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 36 months with 235 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 18 months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 18 months - concurrent with Count 4; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant Irwin Ricky Long in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Irwin Ricky Long in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Counts 4 & 5 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 4 & 5 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court, defendant Irwin Ricky Long not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy fpr Zachary Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant is in custody at the House of Correction.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel McMurray in court, Defendant Irwin Ricky Long not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced from the House of Correction (HOC) for purposes of this hearing.  Defense newly appointed and awaiting discovery.  Defendant will not be produced for purposes of the next hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Irwin Ricky Long in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Defendant Irwin Ricky Long in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Magana moves to withdraw due to taking another position.  Court grants the motion and allows attorney to withdraw.  Court cancels the jury trial for 10-5-15.  Status conference scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Irwin Ricky Long in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Defendant Irwin Ricky Long in custody.  Dennis Murphy for Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Irwin Ricky Long in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Irwin Ricky Long in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.
